title: Structs
description: Structs allow you to create composite types by grouping related data. Each struct defines a blueprint for objects with named, typed fields. Access members using the dot operator (.) for direct instances or arrow operator (->) for pointers. Structs are not automatically initialized - you must manually set each field or create an initialization function. Structs can be passed by value (copied) or by pointer (more efficient for large structs). This example demonstrates struct definition, member access, initialization patterns, and basic usage.
